metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4055 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The duration function in the moment package before 2.11.2 for Node.js allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a long string, aka a "regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS)." It was discovered that moment mishandled certain regular expressions. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.

criterions.comment: node-moment: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
